title: Active meditation UI polish: small-screen slider width + unclipped timer shadow

requirements.summary: Reduce volume and seek slider rendered width on very small screens (<390px) to prevent horizontal overflow on the active meditation timer view.
acceptanceCriteria: When viewport width is < 390px, the volume slider and seek/time slider fit within the screen bounds with no horizontal overflow/clipping.
When viewport width is >= 390px, slider widths remain visually unchanged from the current design.

file_operations.description: In the 'active' meditation timer view, adjust the two Slider components (volume + seek/time) to render ~10–20% narrower when viewport width is <390px (e.g., Tailwind max-[389px] responsive width reduction) and keep the current width at >=390px. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Remove overflow clipping that cuts off the circular SVG timer fill/shadow on the active meditation timer view while avoiding new page scrollbars.
acceptanceCriteria: During timer progress/fill animation, the circular SVG timer’s shadow is not visibly clipped by a container boundary.
The active meditation page does not introduce unwanted page scrolling as a result of removing overflow clipping (no persistent horizontal scrollbar).

file_operations.description: In the 'active' meditation timer view, remove/replace any overflow-hidden styling that can clip the SVG timer's drop-shadow (including ensuring the SVG itself allows overflow visibility), and add only the minimal overflow constraint needed to prevent persistent horizontal scrolling (e.g., constrain x-axis only).
